title: bitcoinmonkey_org
author: bitcoinmonkey_org
created_time: June 11, 2023, 09:53:53 AMLast edit: December 12, 2023, 03:09:26 PM by bitcoinmonkey_org
content: Hi all, I just put online:https://www.bitcoinmonkey.org/It's a trending crypto news aggregator.I initially created it just for myself, to find interesting stuff to read, and with Bitcoin Monkey I gave it a decent looking web interface.It collects news from all major crypto news outlets, categorize them, assign a score, and calculate some stats, in order to surface the best trending news of the moment.Any feedback, suggestion, or critique will be appreciated!  It's still in its early days, so it's a bit rough on the edges, and I am still adjusting the algorithm that calculates the score for each news and categorize them.PS: you won't be tracked by Google Analytics  I self-host a basic privacy-respecting analytics platform to get just a few info about website usage.

comments.author: bitcoinmonkey_org
comments.body: After a bit of a hiatus, I am back.I recently did a major update in both the website UI/UX and in the way scores are calculated and I have a few major updates coming in the next few weeks to make the site a bit more useful and interesting.Stay tuned.In the meantime, if you have any feedback, feel free to chime in  What  do you think of the website?What would you like to see or what do you feel it's missing?Cheers,Stefano, bitcoinmonkey.org

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Nice one.I appreciate the fact that the site is clean with no annoying ads that we usually find in such site. I don't know how long it will be like this, but I pray it stays that way long enough  I have one suggestion. Could you please add a toggle between light and dark mode?

comments.author: bitcoinmonkey_org
comments.body: Thanks Dark theme is in the pipeline, I should be able to push it live before the end of the year along with better archive pages for news about a specific crypto or topic (which for now are just a list of all news).Of course I will want to find a way of monetizing the site, but I want to build a solid userbase first. Anyway I am not planning of plastering the site with ad banners (especially not Google AdSense or the likes).IF I reach the point where I will be able to monetize the site, the aim is to sell ad spaces directly to relevant companies only, and just have 1 or 2 (unobtrusive) spots in the page.Another mid-to-long term plan is to create a daily or weekly curated newsletter.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: The UI is very attractive, the design is impressive, but the site is a little crowded and there is no way to rearrange or divide the screen or search for a specific topic or use a specialized keyword. If you make the split screen dynamic so that the user can delete or modify parts and improve the algorithm for displaying hot events, you will get great traffic.

comments.author: bitcoinmonkey_org
comments.body: Thanks for the advice Yamane_Keto!What do you exactly mean with "split screen dynamic"? Do you have any example?As for rearranging and search for specific topic/keywords, that's something I was thinking about too. A way to set your preferred crypto and topics to have a customized homepage to your liking.And maybe even compose a "watchlist" of specific crypto to see in the sidebar.But that would require a considerable dev effort, so it's something that might be done in the mid-long term. Maybe in the 2nd or 3rd quarter of 2024. Unfortunately I have only limited time to dedicate to this project for now, but your feedback is really appreciated!

comments.author: bitcoinmonkey_org
comments.body: FYI: I fixed an issue with the Reddit APIs which made the order of top news a bit wacky...Now it's all back to normal, and you should also be able to see links to top Reddit threads about each news (if there are any).Over the next few weeks I'd like to integrate also LinkedIn and Facebook APIs, have a better idea of the popularity of each news and sort them accordingly.If one day this site will earn some money I might even add Twitter APIs, but they are just too expensive at this point
